reviewText: My map broke like cheap crockery ages ago, proof that there's always more a person can lose. I drift the barren country, agitated and directionless, meting out indiscriminate vengeance with a fistful of wrenches and a sawed-off tube of buckshot. The engine chokes itself, Chumbucket curses his automotive benediction, and I cruise the winding causeways in search of peace but plagued by questions: why does the Magnum Opus have an automatic transmission? Where have all the motorcycles gone? Didn't I have a baby boy and not a girl? So many questions. So much loss. None of it matters. A plume on the horizon fast approaching. The engine strains, and for several brief, frenzied moments, the world is sand and rending metal and the sweet, rarefied stench of fuel sprung free. I am baptised in guzzoline. I am purified by flame.

reviewText:
Mad Max is decent sandbox game.

Pros:
- Car battles are fun
- Fighting system is good (Arkham series)
- Open world with lots to do

Cons:
- Repetition
- Bugs
- Developer and Publisher don't respond to support tickets

The repetition is not as bad as people make it out to be. Yes, you do a lot of the same things over and over, but most of it is entertaining enough to keep doing. The car battles are pretty fun, and contrary to what others say I actually think there's not enough of it.

I purchased the game six days ago, during the Steam Winter sale, having no expectations whatsoever. The game literally popped up on my main screen and I thought to myself Why the hell not".

Six days later I can only say that this is one of
date: if not - the best game purchases I've ever made!\n\nThe game mechanics and progression are really well made. It felt very natural to me - seamless and flowing. It might not be as charming for some people due to the kind of repetitive game style (doing the same things over and over) but for me this is the first game in a while that just made me sit down

You just don't see that in games nowadays or at least I haven't for quite some time.

MAJOR PROPS to all the people involved in the creation of this game!

reviewText:
Mad max is another massive open world game full of loads of different tasks to complete...

So Firstly let me start this review off by saying that this game is VERY well optimised and for me personally it runs at 40fps on my over clocked 3 year old laptop. So Thank you whoever made this for not leaving us pc gamers out of the equation.

The Story in Mad max is pretty bland as you might expect, if you are interested in what little one it is then here is a brief explanation for you
- Max gets his Precious Car stolen by a Bad guy named Scrotus
- You meet a guy called Chumbucket who makes cars and parts with scrap
-You team up and over time build yourself up to get Revenge on Scrotus.

Okay thats enough of the story... Go play it for yourself if you want to find out more :D

The graphics are outstanding on this game and it is easily one of the best looking games I have ever seen especially when the sandstorms come into play.

The campaign will take on average around 15-20 hours to complete excluding the side missions and it was also very fun to play but others may say that it gets a bit repettive with all of the driving and fighting you have to do.

The world like I said at the start of this review is full of things to see and do. The attention to detail on this game is unlike no other I have seen this year.

My downsides would be that all of the boss battles are pretty much identical with the mehods you need to kill them which is pretty sad because I like a bit more variation with these things. When playing them it reminded me a hell of a lot like the Wolf boss battles in the Order 1886 which is not a good thing in my book.

Another downside is the extremely bland fighting controls, All you have is punch, block and a couple other special moves".

My final downside would be to do with the extremely bland ending which I will not spoil here.

Overall
date:
Since this game is on sale it is a must buy!

My rating is a 8/10

UPDATE 1- Have a look at my Profile for some screenshots :D

UPDATE 2- I recommend installing Windows 10 as it gave the game a 3fps boost for me :D"

reviewText: Absolutely adore this game. It kinda suffers from that problem that a lot of open world games these days suffer from (mosdtly from Ubisoft) where it basically just gives you a laundry list of things to do. In concept, it doesn't sound fun, but in actual gameplay it is pulled off surprisingly well, considering how wonderful the mechanics of the game flow with oneanother. This game has a lot of really good design choices that are so discrete most people wouldn't notice them. Things such as when you're taking down an encampment, when you get to the end and finish it, they always make an easy way to get back to your Magnum Opus rather than making you backtrack through the entire area, I love that. Little details like that go a LONG way towards enjoyment. There are also a few very bad design choices, such as the boss fights which are very tedious and generally annoying. Luckily they're fairly far enough between that it doesn't get in the way often. The driving is perfect, not much to say there. The weapons feel powerful and have a very satisfying animation when they are used. Also not much to say about the on-foot combat, it's been done before, and better, but it's solid and I relish any opportunity I get to beat the heck out of some War Boys. Customization of your Magnum Opus and Max I also feel are a stroug point, because of how tangible the benefits of upgrading each are. With each upgrade there is a noticeable change in how the game plays. For example, changing out the tires od the Magnum Opus dramatically changes the way you approach driving. Some specialize in dricing on sand, off road, or on asphalt. The feeling of progression is wonderful. The story isn't all that great, but that's alright in my book considering the newest entry to the Mad Max thatrical series (Fury Road) was also lacking in story, but that seems like a strong point. There really isn't such a need for story in games like this because I would rather be ramming cars with my beautiful Magnum Opus or beating bad guys into the ground. And considering how solid the gameplay mechanics are, the lack of story is welcomed. PC performance was absolutely wonderful and I feel that this game should be a role model for other games releasing to follow as far as optimization. I tested the game with multiple setups, even one with an integrated GPU. The game ran beautifully on every setup (with the settings tweaked accordingly of course). I did notice a bit of stutter where the game would freeze for about 1/3 of a second every 15-20 minutes or so. Nothing game breaking, on fact, it was hardly noticeable, but something to keep in mind. It happened on every setup including my 980 with a 4790K. There's also a few performance issues in Gastown later in the game where the frame rate will drop to about 40fps even with my settings turned down on the high end system. Also not too noticeable,but can get annoying, especially considering that area is literally the worst. There's a whole lot more to talk about, but even after 70 hours of play time I still am itching to get back into the game.

reviewText:
Mad Max is a post-apocalyptic, open-world action game featuring Max, a man haunted by his past. Your goal is to travel across the Sands of Silence but to do so you’re going to have to build a new car capable of the long journey, after your trusty Black on Black is stolen by the Immortal Scrotus. Much to Max’s dismay, he can’t build this car alone and must enlist the help of several characters from across the Great White, including the trusty blackfinger, Chumbucket.

Pros:
-Definetly one of the best pc port's of 2015
-A very complete game, well done throughout
-Looks great, and runs well on low end machines
-Simple but satisfying hand combat
-Unique, intense vehicle combat
-Solid Ending
-Best explosions i've seen
-Engine sounds
-Chumbucket
-No DLC nonsense

Cons:
-Somewhat slow progression system at start
-Repetitive objectives

Verdict:
A essential purchase, especially if its on sale.

reviewText:
MAD MAX is one of the better games based on a movie franchise
Title: MAD MAX
Genre: Adventure, beat em up, blowe em up, RPG, driving.
Developer: Avalanche studios
Publisher: WB games

IS IT ANY GOOD?
Yes it is good. What I mean by that is that it aint great but it aint bad either.
still confused? Well let me explain to you why I said this.
Im basing my review on how well it plays, how the story is, the driving  and fighting mechanics and ofcourse how the game handles in general ( performance, glitches and bugs)

PROS
Shooting other people out of their cars with a harpoon has never been so satisfying
Eating dogfood once in a while is apparently good for your health
Batman arkham series inspired hand to hand combat which aint bad
Ramming cars, harpooning cars, blowing cars up.
Lots of explosions ( like a M.Bay movie)
Big sandy world to explore
some intresting side objectives called wasteland missions
Decent voiceacting
A lot of customization on max and the Magnum opus
Progression system (griffa tokens)
Ragdoll glitches are hilarious
game is optimized aswell which is rare these days
THE CONS:
The short average story
None of the characters were really that intresting
Collecting relics and such is a pain in the ♥♥♥ because there are around 200 locations to loot.
Clearing camps, vantage outposts etc takes a while and you can say its pretty repetitive.
The game gets a bit dull and repetitive at times
Dont get me wrong. I do recommend this game. But there are some points on which Mad Max falls short.
So we have to talk about that. I was really excited when they announced the game after seeing the movies. I got ready to have myself a great time.
Did I have a great time? at times.. yes but..

1: the wasteland you drive trough doesnt have a lot to offer in terms of eyecandy. Now I know that thats what they were probably going for but it made me personally fast travel to everything as much as I could.

2: What I didnt  enjoy in this game is the fact that you have to clear all the vantage points, convoy routes, minefields and camps to unlock upgrades for certain items. As I said earlier. the Map is kinda big. there are a bunch of areas. but after clearing 2-3 areas the taking over of camps and clearling minefields becomes repetitive and boring at some points.

Conclusion & Final verdict

To sum it all up and keep it short(ish). The core of the game is great. the ramming the shooting and the fighting is very well executed. the voiceacting is good enough and the wasteland does have enough things to keep you busy. While some of them bore me you might enjoy yourself clearling camps and minefields all day but thats completely up to you ofcourse. Overall I did enjoy the game and the story was decent enough to make me go trough it entirely. The customization is well done and did I mention that the game is  DAMN WELL OPTIMIZED?!

I salute the developers for bringing out a game that works from day one, Has great graphics and just the occasional bug to make you laugh (ragdoll glitches). It is rare these days that games actually work from day one. I appreciate that a lot.

My final verdict for MAD MAX is a good 7.7/10
I recommend this to everyody who's a Mad Max fan and loves to blow stuff up.
(If you get bored fast because things can get a bit repetitive I suggest you buy it on sale)
You will have a good time regardless.

MAD MAX IN ONE SENTENCE:  Max is mad, things get blown up, my face shows a grin of satisfaction.

Want more recommendations? Come see our reviews on our favorite upcoming games! Follow UltraShock Gaming's group curators here!

reviewText:
Mad Max 2015.. what a fun game!

See below for pros and cons.

Overview
I originally thought of this game as a Shadow of Mordor clone, but with cars and desert, and it kind of is but the immersion was more on point than it was with Shadow of Mordor, at least for me it was. It nails the wasteland feel perfectly and manages to pull you in the world of Mad Max and all it's craziness without falling flat. And I must say this game has been optimized beautifuly

Story
You play as Mad Max(as if that wasn't obvious) and take on your fellow companion, Sméagol Chumbucket who has devoted his life to serve you as his blackfinger, and your car, the Magnum Opus as your angel. You will be doing wasteland missions for a ton of interesting characters mostly crazy people and help them thrive as the new leaders in their own regional territory. But Max mostly wants to get his car rebuild after it being wrecked by Scrotus at the beginning of the game, needing to build a car faster, stronger and more badass than his original car, the Black on Black.

Gameplay
It follows the simple Batman Arkham games combat, and makes it more brutal, every punch feels powerful and painful to look at, and if you can get behind the combat on foot, you'll be very happy with this game. You'll be equipped with a shotgun for long range, shivs for combat finishers and the brutal yet satisfying Fury Mode which your punches are harder and looks like Max is putting his whole body in them. Now we have the car combat which is very hit or miss, as the car controls are heavy and delayed, almost like a real car. You can add on extra stuff on your car such as grinders, rams and armors which will affect your cars performance. Your car will be equipped with a harpoon, sniper and thuderpoons and other stuff I never used such as burners(side flamethrowers). Max can gain upgrades as well but they are very direct and are just direct upgrades from what you already have, such as shotgun, knuckles, armor, ammo capacity etc.

Replayability
I will be adding replayability because the whole game is your replaying missions all over again, in order to unlock story missions you need to attack strongholds, that have the same objective(Find oil rig and blow it up) or anything that will lower threat in a territory. Some story missions include doing these same repetitive tasks in 5 regions of the map, if you are ok with this then the game won't be a problem for you, but the game requires you can tollerate the combat and everything else the game offers you, otherwise the game will fall flat near the end.

PROS    Great on-foot combat
Perfect optimization
Amazing graphics for how well it runs
Big and immersive worldCONS    Repetitive gameplay
Meh car controls(subjective)
Max is a complete bully in this game
All in all, great game, immersive and great atmosphere. A bit repetitive and meh car controls.

I'd give this game a 8/10

reviewText: Mad Max - Sandstorm
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
If devs could mix assassins creed combat with GTA racing, Mad Max would be born. The game starts with a roar and ends with the gamer wondering if doing it again is worth it.

The story (which is a pretty interesting one to say the least) revolves around the gamer playing as Max, a man scavenging the desert wastelands. As you progress through the game, you unlock upgrades for your car and perform different missions for various warlords. Max does this in hope of getting to gastown, a town filled with all the guzzoline (not gasoline) one could wish for. Unfortunately, the whole wasteland is overrun by Scrotus's War Boys. Max has to clear out their camps to get rid of the threat in different areas.

The gameplay is simple but has it's moments of fun. There are only two buttons required for combat : parry and strike. While it is simple, clearing out 10 to 15 guys in a in a camp is satisfying until it starts becoming redundant.  Additionally while engaging in combat, cans of gas can be lit on fire to blow up enemies and shotguns can be used to get enemies at a distance. The driving part is fun due to it's simplicity but isn't as action packed as clearing a camp The driving controls are your basic right trigger to accelerate and joystick to control the wheels. The car has the ability to ram into others with a simple tap of the button. The car, the Magnum Opus is very customizable. The areas that of the car such as engine (transmission), body armor and thunder poons, which is the coolest weapon. Additionally,  players can acquire cool hood ornaments that give the car upgrades. To take down enemies in towers, sniper rifles and harpoons can be used for extreme distances. There are many ways to keep entertained when roaming around, you may clear out scarecrows, scavenge war boy locations, and (of course) clear out gas camps.

Graphics and sounds are also well done in this game. If your car takes damage, it's very apparent. Max will be bruised up and walk with a limp if he falls a certain distance. Your car can also go up in flames if you damage it too much. There is a neat visual feature in which Max's hair becomes longer over the course of the game. Max himself is also customizable. The sand looks very clean as do all the enemies. (When you bump into rocks or drive through a large pool of sand, the environment will react to you. There is a huge variation in the Scrotus War Boys compared to the many enemies that appear very different. The camps also look amazing. Many details are put into secret entrances into the camps so it is difficult to find the small opening you need to get in. The progression through camps is also what makes them special. Many small details go into making the huge world look clear to the human eyes. The water and sand look like they should but they vary in their appearance depending on which region Max is in. The enemies make noises when they fall off ledges and get hit. The sound is clear and grunts are well heard. Max seems to be in an active environment at all times.

The story line/campaign could have been better but seems to be the high light of the game. As I've said, it becomes repetitive : go collect or defeat this warlord can lose its grace after a while. Clearing out minefields and scarecrows can easily become tedious (and booooring). Also, when you have to drive across the map for sulphur, that's enough to drive anyone crazy. The game is good but has the potential to be a lot better. Following missions and clearing out camps can keep only keep you busy and entertained to a certain extent. All in all, this is a decent game. If you enjoy driving around in a free world like GTA and a bit of action raiding camps, this will appeal to you. It seems everyone I talk to either quit this game after 2 hours or kept playing it. It truly is a game in which I feel anyone can pick up and learn to play easily within an hour (which isn't always necessarily bad)!


I will recommend this game but with extreme caution. If one of your friends has this and their sharing this game with you, better to play it that way!


RATING : Regular average 7.0/10

reviewText:
Alright. 48/49 achievements down. Full story beat. Play time isnt accurate to my steam account as a friend plays when I'm not. The above save (mine) sits at 99.3 hours total for anyone curious and the final achievement is... one that could take an hour or another ten heh.

Fun game, open world. Vehicle use feels like RAGE or Far Cry 4 with a masterpiece combat system. Grappeling hooks, thunderpoon(rocket launcher), nitrous, fully upgradeable vehicles, over fifty vehicles ingame btw.

On foot combat is melee focused, your only ranged weapon is your shotgun but ammunition limits plus overall use steers you towards melee combat which feels like any of the batman titles.

The story itself feels set aside all the way until the last 15% of the story play at which point it goes knee deep and becomes more engaging. Sadly though it dosent answer some popular questions amongst this franchises fanbase such as a, where is fury road timeline wise with the original trilogy and b, is this the original mad max or someone else and c, is he married before the game or during the game only.

Thankfully the story isnt the main focus of enjoyment. There are hundreds of places to explore/loot, vehicles to collect and upgrade, talent points, races, convoys to chase everywhere, strongholds to build, relics to collect, it rocks!

I walk away from this game now (until some sort of dlc of course) satisfied that I got my money's worth out of it. I'd like dlc, I'd like more lore depth explored, more non hostile groups out there in the wastes to encounter, more exploration in to ruins of the old world, there's lots of potential here. I have no hope that this game will match fallout 4 when it arrives but there is ALOT that can be done to this game to put it on a level near F4 when it hits in november :)

reviewText:
The one things some players I seen on you tube is they go in thinking this is fury road, but what was done is basicly they took aspects of the movies and did a outstanding story line of there own version for the lone wolf Max. The location is the bottom of a dried up ocean, it wasn't so much the ships giving me the clue but the coral and dried up sea weed as well. You have your rivle bandit gangs. You have your mission story lines, one of the things I did was wounder off on my own in the game, And yes, you can do that.

Being a Stalker in the Zone from the stalker series, I am use to exploring and looking for salvege anyway. So this game comes home to that for me. The most outstanding thing in the game is the ability to asign key bindings. I use a speacle combat key layout compatable for many of my games that work in STALKER series, COD series, Elder scroll series, and the fall out series.

And it is so refreshing to see I can also use that here. And the binding are split between the car and ground(foot) controls which is a sweet deal to prevent control conflicts. Driving can be a bit tricky, but I have discovered you do not have to fly at high speed all the time, speed can work against you. For example one of the cars chasing me from the grave yard was on me, but I turn right and left and it cause him to shake loose giving me enough room to lock up the brakes, he passed me, and I blew up him up by shooting his tank. They realy put serious thought to actuly plauseability car control. The positive I have been coming across so far in this game, I have no choice but to recomend it!

EDITED 4/18/2016
I had finished the game, I didn't care much for the death races, they really were not my thing. So really the only way I will do it, I have to be forced into it. SO... I was. The Stank Gum race I hated the most. You really have to configure that car. All the speed is not that answare, nor is all the armor. I used the wild hunt through the whole game, and I had it almost stripped down to a compleat stock car. You may get a bif time gap before boom, but that was all redundant. The key was how fast you can take out stank gum in the race. I had to finsh him off inside of a lap. So going into the second lap after passing the start line I defeated him. Then its like the game gets crazy.

In the end the game is open for free roaming. Once I got my rewards of free roaming, I actully for got the fustaration of all that from stank gum to scrotuis. And was happy. I Kind of wish now I didn't do all them side missions I could have dodged, or find all them scrap locations. Its been very quiet. I have car jacked a few vehicles to add to my colection. Still do not bother with the death races. But you know what, I am good with that. Maybe I just pay it again and do some things different.

My recommendation still STANDS...

reviewText:
Mad Max is a game you can't get enough of, I can play it all day, which I have been for a few days, I usualy play 3-4 hours, and it's not boring, a lot gore, and a lot of fun! I love this game and what it has to offer, the fist fighting is great, but I also love the car action. Another cool thing about Mad Max is that you can upgrade you and your car a lot! Mad max has outstanding amount of fun.

It may have some bugs and optimization issues, but Mad Max is one of the best games I have ever played before. It offers so much fun and adventure, it is kinda hard to say you don't like it. I highly suggested thinking of buying this masterpiece, because who wouldn't want too?

Some pros:

~ Great intense action
~ Good storyline
~ Car action
~ Amazing graphics
~ Chumbucket c:
~ Replayability
~ Customization
~ Really good atmosphere
~ Open world
~ Difficulty
~ Good voice acting
~ Addicting
~ Explosions

Cons

~ Sometimes you get FPS lag
~ Bugs and glitches
~ ...

So yes, basically, Mad Max is AMAZING. I get that it might not be some peoples cup of tea, but for those who enjoy punching and clobbering bad guys with your fists, and objects, I highly recommend this to you.

I rate this: 9/10

reviewText:
Heyyo, BIG RECOMMENDATION for this game. It's definitely a surprise hit of 2015. I wasn't expecting too much from this game until I did more digging to find out that Avalanche Studios is behind it... the people who brought us Just Cause 2 and the decently fun original Just Cause. I decided to get it and I was pleasantly surprised. Definitely among the best Movie to Video Game adaptations.

The open world is everything that should be a Mad Max game. It's violent, lots of scavenging (even for gross food types to refill your health) and lots to do. The areas aren't super unique minus changes in enemy vehicle appearances and combat characteristics which is plenty fine by me as you constantly evolve the Magnum Opus, the vehicle that Mad Max uses for most of the game sections.

The vehicles are the best part of the game which is good since what kind of game would Mad Max be if the car combat sucked right? lol... but they definitely focused a lot on getting the vehicle handling and physics right combined with the combat and it makes it so enjoyable to wreck enemies... the only gripe I'd have? Late in the game? You get barely any scrap (tbh I think it's the same amount of scrap as the beginning of the game lol) for destroying enemy cars that I found it a little tedious instead of a good way to get more scrap to keep upgrading.

On-foot combat is quite smooth and it varies between basic attack, weapon attacks, countering, dodging and fury mode which makes Max really strong and can make swarms of enemies a little more bearable without making it too easy which is good… my only gripe? Mini-bosses… they’re all just reskins. Some have their own Biography in the “Bio” menu… but the exact same attacks and all that…. Wish there was more variety other than just textures. Even the Buzzards have the same thing but a different NPC model.

The Avalanche Engine used in this game btw? VERY well optimized. The game looks great at max settings and can do 60fps without issues and I don’t get any dropped frames. It might also be due to less things to render since it’s a barren wasteland, but no matter where I was it ran smooth with the game making good use of my i7 CPU and two-way SLI GTX 680 2GB setup. Oddly enough? There isn’t a graphical preset for maximum graphical settings so you’ll want to manually go through the settings to max the graphics out.

There isn’t much for story much like the movies but what is here is still decent and it did want me to see how the game ended. Same goes for characters. There isn’t a large cast, but the cast that is here are all quite different from each other and the voice acting for all of them was pretty darn good overall.

So for fans of open world action games? Definitely play Mad Max. It’s worth it. I had about 47 hours of playtime with doing the majority of side quests and beating the game so it's got good length to it too.

reviewText:
I ~do~ recommend this game... with a gigantic qualifier.  It's great... BUT...

This has been one of the most enjoyable games I've played in some time.  No bugs to speak of, fluid ground combat, good car mechanics (in the open, anyway), good atmospherics.  I had nothing bad to say about this game... until the Gastwon Race.  This is a story mission that basically locks off the V8 engine and all further story advancement if you cannot complete it.

And I cannot.

It's not a matter of trying again or trying with a different configuration of car components.  I've tried and tried, and I've read online guides (such as they are) and the bottom line is that this beautiful, fun game ~ruined~ its reputation with me because of this one, required, mission for which there is precious little precedent.  The death races, the most similar mission, are wide open.  Racing in the confines of the Gastown track is an entirely different experience.

I would have liked to have seen the ~rest~ of the game, but this one mission that I cannot beat has pretty much bricked the game for me.   I got the game on sale, which is the only way I can advocate getting it, now.  And at that, I would urge people to enjoy the game ~while you can~ because that Gastown Race would infuriate a pope.

reviewText:
Lovely imagery and a decent Far Cry 3 meets Red Faction Gureilla with some fun gameplay but only IF you can get through the first three hours and scripted hand holding ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Get through that and the game finally takes the training wheels off so that you can do your own thing.

The progression system is daft and I'm still annoyed to have religiously collected scrap only to have all the stuff I want locked away until I progress further in the story.

Yes, it's good. Yes it looks good. Yes it's fun. Yes it has a big map but bloody hell, that initial grind is annoying.

Just for the annoying hand holding and directed gameplay for the first three hours, it's only worth buying if it's in a sale.

Edit to add: After 40 hours I've completed the storyline and the storyline is this game is simply one of the best I've played. I'm still miffed at the hand holding at the start and at how you're forced to do some things to progress the storyline but the story telling itself is incredibly well done.

reviewText:
I'm a big fan of the Mad Max films and remember seeing them as a little boy, in awe of the style and darkness of its universe, and I'm pretty sure it was one of the major influences for me taking up film production as a career. I recently saw the new film and was very impressed by its return, most notably in the production design of the vehicles, war boys and the world in which they lived.

This game is a fantastic expansion on that universe, setting its own story, mood and pace within that Mad Max universe. It's like a post apocalyptic GTA and all that matters is making sure your motor keeps getting better. I was able to run around for hours enjoying the added side jobs and trying to improve on my Magnus Opus (the car) before I even really tackled the story, but once I did, I was fully entertained.

Good car upgrading and customisation
Good fight mechanics and upgradable skills
Freaking awesome road fights
Big camps to bust in and fight through

But there certainly are some issues like;
The bosses were not very challenging,
It does get very samey after 20 hours, but still adictive.
No multiplayer other than time trials on some races,
Once you upgrade to a mid point in the game (both car and character), it's way too easy.
A few really neat ideas, like collecting gas and water, become redundant way too quickly.

I bought this game on sale and have thoroughly enjoyed my purchase. I recommend this title if you fancy a good solo romp through desolate waste lands, beating every shabby driver to a pulp while you fasten as much spare metal to your car in the effort to be the king of the road. Ride on road warrior.

reviewText:
A quick mini-review of Mad Max after a few hours:

Pros:

It's Mad Freakin'' Max
The story is supposedly canon - which doesn't actually mean much in the Max Max universe, but hey...
Combat is like the Arkham series, only with the ability to shank your opponent.
It looks like something Miller could have dreamt up - excellent level design so far.
Explosions look sooo good.
Game is solid - no major bugs, graphics are smooth as silk and speedy, plenty of PC config options.

Cons:

Driving's a bit...wonky. Car handling is touchy.
I've switched back and forth between Keyboard/Mouse and Gamepad...and gotten frustrated with both.
The FOV is console-level and unadjustable, so you feel like you're breathing down your character's neck  on a widescreen monitor.
I can see some of this getting tedious after a while.


After the Arkham Knight fiasco, it's refreshing to see a PC game come out so polished and beautiful (if a wasteland can be considered beautiful...and it is, actually.)

reviewText:
TL;DR What a game, WHAT A LOVELY GAME!

Let me start by saying that THIS is the gold standard for PC launches. It's a great port in terms of options, it looks great and it runs fabulously. Not only that, but the game is fun to boot. The car combat is satisfying, the fist combat is meaty and far more varied than reviews like Gamespot's would lead you to believe and the RPG elements are satisfying in that they offer meaningful choices. Do I want my car to hit hard and move fast, or do I want to be a lumbering tank? Those choices, as well as anything in between, offer different styles of gameplay that are suitable for anyone who enjoys open world action games.

No ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, just a good game and an even better PC port.

P.S. Since it's developed by Avanlanche, there's even more reason now to get hyped for Just Cause 3.

reviewText:
I'm loving the game so far. Everything runs smooth and looks amazing.
My only problem, with a couple of hours, is the combat.
While it shares a similarity with the Batman series the parry is bad, or at least is badly executed. You will die while counter an enemy if another one is hitting you, which is absurd, and sometimes you right click to parry and you still get hit cause it doesn't register. Seems like Max can't parry when he's not directly facing an enemy, which is a turn down for me.
Yes you have the dodge option but what good is the parry if you have to dodge to not get hit?
I have been dying a couple of times in fights with 4 or 5 + enemies because of this. Not sure if anyone shares the same thoughts.
Apart from that, amazing game. So far a 9/10

reviewText:
Really enjoying this game.

The graphics are absolutely amazing.  The scenery, environment, violence, cars, and explosions look great.
The cars are super fun to drive, I hate having to leave it to do stuff on foot.


However, there are some things lacking in my opinion.

The start can feel grindy (i'm still on the start).  Having to run around and gather scrap is a bit tedious for me.  However, there is suppose to be something you can build that will let NPC's to gather your scraps for you.  I haven't gotten to it yet.
There is NO MULTIPLAYER.  This game would have done great with MP.  Even a COOP mode.  Car battles or Convoy missions could easily have been made.  Disregarding server costs :P
No Motorcycles either.  Motorcycles are a big part of the Mad Max universe, but there aren't even NPC motorcycles.


The Story isn't that immersive or great. It's just alright.


The saving grace of this game is the Universe it's set in, the amazing graphics, and the incredible optomization.

IMO, buy it if you like SP games.

reviewText:
his game is an absolute blast. If you enjoy Arkham Knight or Shadow of Morrodor and like the Mad Max franchise - Pull the trigger on this one. Lots to do - So many little details that make it feel like you're in the wasteland. Upgrading your car, the Magnum Opus is fun and fulfilling. Also this game has a neat feature i haven't seen before where you can have a person use a second controller to move the camera and record cinematic style. Cool stuff.

reviewText:
Mad Max is basically what would happen if  Red Dead Redemption and Far Cry 3 had a baby together and then that baby grew up trained by Batman.  The gameplay is excellent (controller button mapping takes a bit getting used to) and the story is epic.  It plays out as a nice prequel to the fury road movie.

+++satisfying boom and fireball when things explode
+graphics are gorgeous and smooth
+screenshot/video capture mode
+attention to detail
+no bugs or patches out of the box

Cons
- button mapping takes some getting used to, I keep accidentally firing my shotgun (B button) and ammo is sparse
- dialog can sometimes be difficult to hear (using the theater sound setting)

reviewText:
Great game! Not sure if worth $60, but definitely on par with some of the $50 titles out there!

Combat is entertaining without being repetitive, each enemy has it's different style of doing things that makes you think. The combat animations are pure gold, it's not fancy martial-arts, but true street style brawling that is more about inflicting damage than looking good.

Car driving is a bit tricky to get the hang of, and I did not like the default keybinds, but once you get a couple miles under your belt, it's entertaining to go cruise around the wasteland looking for trouble.

Upgrade menu is diverse and full of wonderful options and additions that make you look forward to grinding out a couple more camps to unlock them.

Overall story is kind of weak, but it's Mad Max, story doesn't really matter as much as the overall bizarre encounters. From pirates, to junkies, to psychopaths, the game has a really varied character lineup.



Overall, I love the heck out of this game and I can't wait to see what they add in later.

reviewText: A nicely made sandbox set in the Mad Max universe. It features a vast but sadly, unvaried array of tasks packed into a landscape that captures very well the desolation of a post-apocalyptic scorched desert. Fans of the movies will find plenty to like in this tale of redemption for the franchise's namesake along with his eccentric sidekick and trusty canine companion. If you are looking for Fallout class scope in this game you will be disappointed. However, if you pick this title up without expectations of restoring humanity, you might just find some charm in cruising the wastes in a jury rigged, supercharged mongrelmobile.

reviewText:
This game runs the way all PC game should. I can't imagine anyone having technical problems without.

As for the game itself, it's a lot of fun. The world is atmospheric and well realized, and the combat and driving are nice and tight.

No reason not to get this game if you like the theme and genre.

reviewText:
Certain game review websites panned this game.  I quite honestly don't know what they disliked so much about it.  It's an open world, take over camps, type of game.  Think Farcry 3 and 4.  I, however, think this is more fun than Farcry 4.  The combat system is almost exactly like the Arkham games, that is to say, great.  The Mad Max universe is rich with blood, explosions, and fuel.  If you've seen Fury Road, it's like that, but more gory.  Also, it runs fantastic.  If you've got a mid-range PC, you can run it without compromising graphical quality.

Pros:
-Huge world
-Great combat
-Fun upgrades
-Runs great
-Good character design
-Good voice acting
-Great atmosphere and mood

Cons:
-Jumping and climbing can be a little clunky
-Can be repetitive
